__e: A minute ago, you said you had no telephone at all. Didn't you?
You had no right to kill them especially in God's name!
You had no right to release my patient without consulting me first.
Well, you didn't have to say it.
You know... I realize you didn't have to come back for me.
I am your advocate and I repeat you did not give them so much.
I wonder if you have had Tadashi's child?
I'm not sure if you will believe me, but this is my sincere apology.
It would have been much easier for you if you hadn't seen this.
You were always kind to me, even when you had nothing to gain.
I didn't think you had anything to hide and I just thought it would save time.
Did you ever meet his wife? His late wife.
You were contacted by a man you didn't know,
Why, you and Bobby acted as if you hadn't seen a police car in your lives.
YOU TELLIN' ME YOU NEVER THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOUR WIFE?
You are finished now, as if you had not ever been made.
Driven approximately two and a half to three hours to a place You've never been to before. Haven't the slightest idea where it is.
And it never occurred to you to even think about trying to look for one...
But you had no idea, you had no indication she might have taken her own life?
I thought I heard you telling him that you hadn't heard from your friend Len Fisher. Not for three years.
Of course, you had no personal motive... in picking Paris, did you?
But you had no way of knowing that.
Well, you had no way of knowing the truth, so you jumped in.
I thought my cooperation was no longer needed.
Yes, we could tell you weren't afraid anymore.
You thought you had lost your voice, but it was only a dream
